intro: Sphaerostephanos bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's globe-stephanos, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, globular inflorescence composed of numerous small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in a dense, spherical shape. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a cool, Mediterranean climate to flourish. Its floral display is particularly notable during the spring and early summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
